intro: Lipochaeta remyi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Lipochaeta remyi is adapted to arid environments and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience.
